member.name: T:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.AspNet.Mvc.WebViewPageExtensions
member.summary: Adds ImageUltimate related extensions methods to class for ASP.NET MVC support.

member.name: M:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.AspNet.Mvc.WebViewPageExtensions.ImageTag(System.Web.Mvc.WebViewPage,System.String,System.Action{GleamTech.ImageUltimate.AspNet.ImageWebTask})
member.summary: Returns an image element with a unique and browser-cacheable url for the processed image. The first time this method is called, the image will be processed and cached on the server. The url will vary according to the processing commands so browser cache will be updated automatically when you change the parameters.
member.param: The instance.

The virtual or physical path to the image to process. If a plain file name (eg. Picture.jpg) or a non-rooted path (eg. SomeFolder/Picture.jpg) is given, it will considered relative to the default source path set by . If the given path is rooted (eg ~/Picture.jpg, /SomeFolder/Picture.jpg or C:\SomeFolder\Picture.jpg), the exact path will be used, ie. the default source path will be ignored.
The method for processing the image. This is usually a lambda expression which chains image processing commands.
member.returns: The image element.

member.name: T:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.AspNet.ImageUltimateWebConfiguration
member.summary: Provides properties and methods for changing this library's configuration for web use.

member.name: M:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.AspNet.ImageUltimateWebConfiguration.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: P:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.AspNet.ImageUltimateWebConfiguration.CacheLocation
member.summary: Gets or sets the location to store cached images. The default value is "~/App_Data/ImageCache". The location can be a plain physical/virtual path string or a instance for one of the supported file systems like Amazon S3 and Azure Blob. When you use a cache path within the current application's root directory (e.g. "~/SomeFolder", "/SomeFolder" or "C:\inetpub\wwwroot\MySite\SomeFolder"), the request will be handled directly via IIS (using RewritePath) for better download performance.

member.name: P:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.AspNet.ImageUltimateWebConfiguration.CachePath
member.summary: Gets or sets the path to store cached images. The default value is "~/App_Data/ImageCache". Value can be a virtual or physical path. Deprecated, please use CacheLocation instead.

member.name: P:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.AspNet.ImageUltimateWebConfiguration.CacheMaxDays
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum number of days to store cached images. The default value is 90 days.

member.name: M:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.AspNet.ImageUltimateWebConfiguration.GetCache
member.summary: Gets the image cache used by this web configuration instance.
member.returns: A instance.

member.name: P:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.AspNet.ImageUltimateWebConfiguration.SourcePath
member.summary: Gets or sets the default source path for finding images. The default value is "~/App_Data/ImageSource". Value can be a virtual or physical path, however always returns a physical path, ie. if the original value was a virtual path, returns the resolved physical path. Whenever a plain file name (eg. Picture.jpg) or a non-rooted path (eg. SomeFolder/Picture.jpg) is passed to a image loading/processing method, it will be considered relative to this source path. If the path passed to the method is rooted (eg ~/Picture.jpg, /SomeFolder/Picture.jpg or C:\SomeFolder\Picture.jpg), this source path will be ignored for that method call.

member.name: P:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.AspNet.ImageUltimateWebConfiguration.RewritePathEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies whether RewritePath should be enabled. The default is true. When you use a cache path within the current application's root directory (e.g. "~/SomeFolder", "/SomeFolder" or "C:\inetpub\wwwroot\MySite\SomeFolder"), the request will be handled directly via IIS (using RewritePath) for better download performance. If you set this property to false, then the internal download handler will be forced so that byte-range requests are supported.

member.name: P:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.AspNet.ImageUltimateWebConfiguration.ImageHandlerPath
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies the path for the image handler. The default value is "image.ashx". Normally you would not need to change the default value.

member.name: M:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.AspNet.ImageUltimateWebConfiguration.InitCurrent
member.summary: Initializes only the static Current instance.

member.name: P:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.AspNet.ImageUltimateWebConfiguration.Current
member.summary: Gets current global configuration instance.

member.name: M:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.AspNet.ImageUltimateWebConfiguration.PreApplicationStart
member.summary: Runs automatically before the ASP.NET application is started.

member.name: M:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.AspNet.ImageUltimateWebConfiguration.RestoreRoutes
member.summary: Restores the necessary routes in case you cleared RouteTable.Routes in your application.

member.name: T:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.AspNet.ImageWebTask
member.summary: Provides methods for processing a source image in a chained manner for web use and caching the resulting image. This class can not be instantiated, it's passed as a parameter to your lambda expression so that you can chain image processing commands.

member.name: M:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.AspNet.ImageWebTask.Format(GleamTech.ImageUltimate.AspNet.ImageWebSafeFormat)
member.summary: Overrides the file format for the resulting image. By default the same file format of the source image will be used and if that format is not supported for saving, then Jpeg format will be used.
member.param: The web-safe file format used to save the image.
member.returns: The same instance of this class.

member.name: M:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.AspNet.ImageWebTask.FileName(System.String)
member.summary: Overrides the file name (excluding extension) of the resulting image in the generated url (usually for SEO purposes). By default the same name of the source image will be used. Note that the file extension is appended automatically according to the current save format.
member.param: The file name (excluding extension) to use in the generated url.
member.returns: The same instance of this class.

member.name: T:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ColorSpace
member.summary: Defines the color spaces of images.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ColorSpace.Undefined
member.summary: Undefined color space.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ColorSpace.CMY
member.summary: CMYK without black separation.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ColorSpace.CMYK
member.summary: CMYK is a subtractive color model used in color printing. CMYK refers to the four inks used in color printing: cyan, magenta, yellow, and key (black).

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ColorSpace.Gray
member.summary: Grayscale, also known as black-and-white, is a color model composed exclusively of shades of gray, varying from black at the weakest intensity to white at the strongest.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ColorSpace.HCL
member.summary: HCL (Hue, Chroma, Luminance)

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ColorSpace.HCLp
member.summary: HCLp is a modification of HCL to try to match Photoshop.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ColorSpace.HSB
member.summary: HSB (Hue, Saturation, Brightness)

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ColorSpace.HSI
member.summary: HSL (Hue, Saturation, Intensity)

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ColorSpace.HSL
member.summary: HSL (Hue, Saturation, Lightness/Luminance)

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ColorSpace.HSV
member.summary: HSV (Hue, Saturation, Value)

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ColorSpace.HWB
member.summary: HWB (Hue, Whiteness, Blackness)

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ColorSpace.Lab
member.summary: Lab is a three-dimensional color model, where the L stands for the lightness of the color, the “a” is the redness vs. greenness, while the “b” is the yellowness vs. blueness.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ColorSpace.LCH
member.summary: LCH (Lightness, Chroma, Hue)

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ColorSpace.LCHab
member.summary: LCHab is cylindrical transformation of the CIELAB color space.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ColorSpace.LCHuv
member.summary: LCHuv is cylindrical transformation of the CIELUV color space.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ColorSpace.Log
member.summary: Log (short for logarithmic), you can think of log as a color space “archiver” (in the same way zip or rar does it for files).

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ColorSpace.LMS
member.summary: LMS ((long, medium, short), a perceptual color space based on the response functions of the cones in the retina of the eye. It is mostly used in psychophysical research.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ColorSpace.Luv
member.summary: A modification of "CIE 1931 XYZ" to display color differences more conveniently. The CIELUV space is especially useful for additive mixtures of lights, due to its linear addition properties.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ColorSpace.OHTA
member.summary: Object segmentation using OHTA colour space is one of successful methods to separate fruit object and background.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ColorSpace.Rec601YCbCr
member.summary: ITU-R Recommendation BT.601, more commonly known by the abbreviations Rec. 601 or BT.601 (or its former name, CCIR 601) is a standard originally issued in 1982 by the CCIR.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ColorSpace.Rec709YCbCr
member.summary: ITU-R Recommendation BT.709, more commonly known by the abbreviations Rec. 709 or BT.709, standardizes the format of high-definition television, having 16:9 (widescreen) aspect ratio.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ColorSpace.RGB
member.summary: RGB is an additive color model in which red, green, and blue light are added together in various ways to reproduce a broad array of colors.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ColorSpace.scRGB
member.summary: scRGB is a wide color gamut RGB (Red Green Blue) color space created by Microsoft and HP that uses the same color primaries and white/black points as the sRGB color space but allows coordinates below zero and greater than one.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ColorSpace.sRGB
member.summary: The sRGB color space, or standard RGB (Red Green Blue), is an RGB color space created cooperatively by Hewlett-Packard and Microsoft Corporation for use on the Internet.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ColorSpace.Transparent
member.summary: Transparent color space.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ColorSpace.XyY
member.summary: The XyY color space is a transformation of the CIE XYZ color space onto 2 dimensions.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ColorSpace.XYZ
member.summary: XYZ (aka "CIE 1931") is the first attempt to produce a color space based on measurements of human color perception and the basis for almost all other color spaces.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ColorSpace.YCbCr
member.summary: YCbCr, used widely in video and image compression schemes such as MPEG and JPEG.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ColorSpace.YCC
member.summary: YCC is an extension of YCbCr that extends the color gamut beyond the R/G/B primaries specified by BT.709.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ColorSpace.YDbDr
member.summary: The YDbDr scheme used by SECAM television is rotated in another way.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ColorSpace.YIQ
member.summary: YIQ was formerly used in NTSC (North America, Japan and elsewhere) television broadcasts for historical reasons.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ColorSpace.YPbPr
member.summary: YPbPr is a scaled version of YUV. It is most commonly seen in its digital form.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ColorSpace.YUV
member.summary: The Y′UV model defines a color space in terms of one luma (Y′) and two chrominance (UV) components. The Y′UV color model is used in the PAL composite color video (excluding PAL-N) standard.

member.name: T:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ColorType
member.summary: Defines the color types of images.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ColorType.Undefined
member.summary: Undefined color type.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ColorType.Bilevel
member.summary: A bi-level image contains only two colors: a background color and a foreground color.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ColorType.Grayscale
member.summary: Grayscale (shades of gray).

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ColorType.GrayscaleAlpha
member.summary: Grayscale (shades of gray) with alpha channel.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ColorType.Palette
member.summary: Indexed (palette-based, ie. each pixel is an index in palette rather than color value).

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ColorType.PaletteAlpha
member.summary: Indexed (palette-based) with alpha channel.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ColorType.TrueColor
member.summary: TrueColor is defined to mean 256 shades of red, green, and blue, for a total of 16,777,216 color variations.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ColorType.TrueColorAlpha
member.summary: TrueColor with alpha channel.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ColorType.ColorSeparation
member.summary: Colors separated into the three or four basic ink colors: cyan, magenta, yellow, and black (CMYK).

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ColorType.ColorSeparationAlpha
member.summary: ColorSeparation with alpha channel.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ColorType.Optimize
member.summary: Optimized color type.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ColorType.PaletteBilevelAlpha
member.summary: Indexed (palette-based) bilevel with alpha channel.

member.name: T:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag
member.summary: Defines tags for EXIF (Exchangeable Image File Format) 2.31 specification.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.Unknown
member.summary: Unknown tag.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.ProcessingSoftware
member.summary: The name and version of the software used to post-process the picture.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.NewSubfileType
member.summary: A general indication of the kind of data contained in this subfile.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.SubfileType
member.summary: A general indication of the kind of data contained in this subfile. This field is deprecated. The NewSubfileType field should be used instead.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.ImageWidth
member.summary: The number of columns of image data, equal to the number of pixels per row. In JPEG compressed data a JPEG marker is used instead of this tag.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.ImageLength
member.summary: The number of rows of image data. In JPEG compressed data a JPEG marker is used instead of this tag.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.BitsPerSample
member.summary: The number of bits per image component. In this standard each component of the image is 8 bits, so the value for this tag is 8. See also . In JPEG compressed data a JPEG marker is used instead of this tag.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.Compression
member.summary: The compression scheme used for the image data. When a primary image is JPEG compressed, this designation is not necessary and is omitted. When thumbnails use JPEG compression, this tag value is set to 6.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.PhotometricInterpretation
member.summary: The pixel composition. In JPEG compressed data a JPEG marker is used instead of this tag.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.Thresholding
member.summary: For black and white TIFF files that represent shades of gray, the technique used to convert from gray to black and white pixels.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.CellWidth
member.summary: The width of the dithering or halftoning matrix used to create a dithered or halftoned bilevel file.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.CellLength
member.summary: The length of the dithering or halftoning matrix used to create a dithered or halftoned bilevel file.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.FillOrder
member.summary: The logical order of bits within a byte

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.DocumentName
member.summary: The name of the document from which this image was scanned

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.ImageDescription
member.summary: A character string giving the title of the image. It may be a comment such as "1988 company picnic" or the like. Two-bytes character codes cannot be used. When a 2-bytes code is necessary, the Exif Private tag is to be used.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.Make
member.summary: The manufacturer of the recording equipment. This is the manufacturer of the DSC, scanner, video digitizer or other equipment that generated the image. When the field is left blank, it is treated as unknown.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.Model
member.summary: The model name or model number of the equipment. This is the model name or number of the DSC, scanner, video digitizer or other equipment that generated the image. When the field is left blank, it is treated as unknown.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.StripOffsets
member.summary: For each strip, the byte offset of that strip. It is recommended that this be selected so the number of strip bytes does not exceed 64 Kbytes. With JPEG compressed data this designation is not needed and is omitted. See also and .

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.Orientation
member.summary: The image orientation viewed in terms of rows and columns.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.SamplesPerPixel
member.summary: The number of components per pixel. Since this standard applies to RGB and YCbCr images, the value set for this tag is 3. In JPEG compressed data a JPEG marker is used instead of this tag.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.RowsPerStrip
member.summary: The number of rows per strip. This is the number of rows in the image of one strip when an image is divided into strips. With JPEG compressed data this designation is not needed and is omitted. See also and .

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.StripByteCounts
member.summary: The total number of bytes in each strip. With JPEG compressed data this designation is not needed and is omitted.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.XResolution
member.summary: The number of pixels per in the direction. When the image resolution is unknown, 72 [dpi] is designated.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.YResolution
member.summary: The number of pixels per in the direction. The same value as is designated.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.PlanarConfiguration
member.summary: Indicates whether pixel components are recorded in a chunky or planar format. In JPEG compressed files a JPEG marker is used instead of this tag. If this field does not exist, the TIFF default of 1 (chunky) is assumed.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.GrayResponseUnit
member.summary: The precision of the information contained in the GrayResponseCurve.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.GrayResponseCurve
member.summary: For grayscale data, the optical density of each possible pixel value.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.T4Options
member.summary: T.4-encoding options.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.T6Options
member.summary: T.6-encoding options.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.ResolutionUnit
member.summary: The unit for measuring and . The same unit is used for both and . If the image resolution is unknown, 2 (inches) is designated.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.PageNumber
member.summary: The page number of the page from which this image was scanned.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.TransferFunction
member.summary: A transfer function for the image, described in tabular style. Normally this tag is not necessary, since color space is specified in the color space information tag ().

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.Software
member.summary: This tag records the name and version of the software or firmware of the camera or image input device used to generate the image. The detailed format is not specified, but it is recommended that the example shown below be followed. When the field is left blank, it is treated as unknown.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.DateTime
member.summary: The date and time of image creation. In Exif standard, it is the date and time the file was changed.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.Artist
member.summary: This tag records the name of the camera owner, photographer or image creator. The detailed format is not specified, but it is recommended that the information be written as in the example below for ease of Interoperability. When the field is left blank, it is treated as unknown. Ex.) "Camera owner, John Smith; Photographer, Michael Brown; Image creator, Ken James"

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.HostComputer
member.summary: This tag records information about the host computer used to generate the image.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.Predictor
member.summary: A predictor is a mathematical operator that is applied to the image data before an encoding scheme is applied.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.WhitePoint
member.summary: The chromaticity of the white point of the image. Normally this tag is not necessary, since color space is specified in the colorspace information tag ().

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.PrimaryChromaticities
member.summary: The chromaticity of the three primary colors of the image. Normally this tag is not necessary, since colorspace is specified in the colorspace information tag ().

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.ColorMap
member.summary: A color map for palette color images. This field defines a Red-Green-Blue color map (often called a lookup table) for palette-color images. In a palette-color image, a pixel value is used to index into an RGB lookup table.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.HalftoneHints
member.summary: The purpose of the HalftoneHints field is to convey to the halftone function the range of gray levels within a colorimetrically-specified image that should retain tonal detail.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.TileWidth
member.summary: The tile width in pixels. This is the number of columns in each tile.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.TileLength
member.summary: The tile length (height) in pixels. This is the number of rows in each tile.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.TileOffsets
member.summary: For each tile, the byte offset of that tile, as compressed and stored on disk. The offset is specified with respect to the beginning of the TIFF file. Note that this implies that each tile has a location independent of the locations of other tiles.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.TileByteCounts
member.summary: For each tile, the number of (compressed) bytes in that tile. See TileOffsets for a description of how the byte counts are ordered.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.SubIFDs
member.summary: Defined by Adobe Corporation to enable TIFF Trees within a TIFF file.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.InkSet
member.summary: The set of inks used in a separated (PhotometricInterpretation=5) image.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.InkNames
member.summary: The name of each ink used in a separated (PhotometricInterpretation=5) image.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.NumberOfInks
member.summary: The number of inks. Usually equal to SamplesPerPixel, unless there are extra samples.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.DotRange
member.summary: The component values that correspond to a 0% dot and 100% dot.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.TargetPrinter
member.summary: A description of the printing environment for which this separation is intended.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.ExtraSamples
member.summary: Specifies that each pixel has m extra components whose interpretation is defined by one of the values listed below.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.SampleFormat
member.summary: This field specifies how to interpret each data sample in a pixel.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.SMinSampleValue
member.summary: This field specifies the minimum sample value.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.SMaxSampleValue
member.summary: This field specifies the maximum sample value.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.TransferRange
member.summary: Expands the range of the TransferFunction

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.ClipPath
member.summary: A TIFF ClipPath is intended to mirror the essentials of PostScript's path creation functionality.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.XClipPathUnits
member.summary: The number of units that span the width of the image, in terms of integer ClipPath coordinates.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.YClipPathUnits
member.summary: The number of units that span the height of the image, in terms of integer ClipPath coordinates.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.Indexed
member.summary: Indexed images are images where the 'pixels' do not represent color values, but rather an index (usually 8-bit) into a separate color table, the ColorMap.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.JPEGTables
member.summary: This optional tag may be used to encode the JPEG quantization and Huffman tables for subsequent use by the JPEG decompression process.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.OPIProxy
member.summary: OPIProxy gives information concerning whether this image is a low-resolution proxy of a high-resolution image (Adobe OPI).

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.JPEGProc
member.summary: This field indicates the process used to produce the compressed data

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.JPEGInterchangeFormat
member.summary: The offset to the start byte (SOI) of JPEG compressed thumbnail data. This is not used for primary image JPEG data.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.JPEGInterchangeFormatLength
member.summary: The number of bytes of JPEG compressed thumbnail data. This is not used for primary image JPEG data. JPEG thumbnails are not divided but are recorded as a continuous JPEG bitstream from SOI to EOI. Appn and COM markers should not be recorded. Compressed thumbnails must be recorded in no more than 64 Kbytes, including all other data to be recorded in APP1.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.JPEGRestartInterval
member.summary: This Field indicates the length of the restart interval used in the compressed image data.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.JPEGLosslessPredictors
member.summary: This Field points to a list of lossless predictor-selection values, one per component.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.JPEGPointTransforms
member.summary: This Field points to a list of point transform values, one per component.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.JPEGQTables
member.summary: This Field points to a list of offsets to the quantization tables, one per component.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.JPEGDCTables
member.summary: This Field points to a list of offsets to the DC Huffman tables or the lossless Huffman tables, one per component.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.JPEGACTables
member.summary: This Field points to a list of offsets to the Huffman AC tables, one per component.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.YCbCrCoefficients
member.summary: The matrix coefficients for transformation from RGB to YCbCr image data. No default is given in TIFF; but here the value given in Appendix E, "Color Space Guidelines", is used as the default. The color space is declared in a color space information tag, with the default being the value that gives the optimal image characteristics Interoperability this condition.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.YCbCrSubSampling
member.summary: The sampling ratio of chrominance components in relation to the luminance component. In JPEG compressed data a JPEG marker is used instead of this tag.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.YCbCrPositioning
member.summary: The position of chrominance components in relation to the luminance component. This field is designated only for JPEG compressed data or uncompressed YCbCr data. The TIFF default is 1 (centered); but when Y:Cb:Cr = 4:2:2 it is recommended in this standard that 2 (co-sited) be used to record data, in order to improve the image quality when viewed on TV systems. When this field does not exist, the reader shall assume the TIFF default. In the case of Y:Cb:Cr = 4:2:0, the TIFF default (centered) is recommended. If the reader does not have the capability of supporting both kinds of , it shall follow the TIFF default regardless of the value in this field. It is preferable that readers be able to support both centered and co-sited positioning.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.ReferenceBlackWhite
member.summary: The reference black point value and reference white point value. No defaults are given in TIFF, but the values below are given as defaults here. The color space is declared in a color space information tag, with the default being the value that gives the optimal image characteristics Interoperability these conditions.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.XMLPacket
member.summary: XMP Metadata (Adobe technote 9-14-02)

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.Rating
member.summary: Rating tag used by Windows

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.RatingPercent
member.summary: Rating tag used by Windows, value in percent

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.ImageID
member.summary: ImageID is the full pathname of the original, high-resolution image, or any other identifying string that uniquely identifies the original image (Adobe OPI).

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.CFARepeatPatternDim
member.summary: Contains two values representing the minimum rows and columns to define the repeating patterns of the color filter array

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.CFAPattern
member.summary: Indicates the color filter array (CFA) geometric pattern of the image sensor when a one-chip color area sensor is used. It does not apply to all sensing methods

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.BatteryLevel
member.summary: Contains a value of the battery level as a fraction or string

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.Copyright
member.summary: Copyright information. In this standard the tag is used to indicate both the photographer and editor copyrights. It is the copyright notice of the person or organization claiming rights to the image. The Interoperability copyright statement including date and rights should be written in this field; e.g., "Copyright, John Smith, 19xx. All rights reserved.". In this standard the field records both the photographer and editor copyrights, with each recorded in a separate part of the statement. When there is a clear distinction between the photographer and editor copyrights, these are to be written in the order of photographer followed by editor copyright, separated by NULL (in this case since the statement also ends with a NULL, there are two NULL codes). When only the photographer copyright is given, it is terminated by one NULL code. When only the editor copyright is given, the photographer copyright part consists of one space followed by a terminating NULL code, then the editor copyright is given. When the field is left blank, it is treated as unknown.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.ExposureTime
member.summary: Exposure time, given in seconds.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.FNumber
member.summary: The F number.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.IPTCNAA
member.summary: Contains an IPTC/NAA record

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.ImageResources
member.summary: Contains information embedded by the Adobe Photoshop application

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.ExifTag
member.summary: A pointer to the Exif IFD. Interoperability, Exif IFD has the same structure as that of the IFD specified in TIFF. ordinarily, however, it does not contain image data as in the case of TIFF.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.InterColorProfile
member.summary: Contains an InterColor Consortium (ICC) format color space characterization/profile

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.ExposureProgram
member.summary: The class of the program used by the camera to set exposure when the picture is taken.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.SpectralSensitivity
member.summary: Indicates the spectral sensitivity of each channel of the camera used.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.GPSTag
member.summary: A pointer to the GPS Info IFD. The Interoperability structure of the GPS Info IFD, like that of Exif IFD, has no image data.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.ISOSpeedRatings
member.summary: Indicates the ISO Speed and ISO Latitude of the camera or input device as specified in ISO 12232.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.OECF
member.summary: Indicates the Opto-Electric Conversion Function (OECF) specified in ISO 14524.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.Interlace
member.summary: Indicates the field number of multifield images.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.TimeZoneOffset
member.summary: This optional tag encodes the time zone of the camera clock (relative to Greenwich Mean Time) used to create the DataTimeOriginal tag-value when the picture was taken. It may also contain the time zone offset of the clock used to create the DateTime tag-value when the image was modified.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.SelfTimerMode
member.summary: Number of seconds image capture was delayed from button press.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.DateTimeOriginal
member.summary: The date and time when the original image data was generated.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.CompressedBitsPerPixel
member.summary: Specific to compressed data; states the compressed bits per pixel.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.ShutterSpeedValue
member.summary: Shutter speed.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.ApertureValue
member.summary: The lens aperture.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.BrightnessValue
member.summary: The value of brightness.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.ExposureBiasValue
member.summary: The exposure bias.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.MaxApertureValue
member.summary: The smallest F number of the lens.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.SubjectDistance
member.summary: The distance to the subject, given in meters.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.MeteringMode
member.summary: The metering mode.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.LightSource
member.summary: The kind of light source.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.Flash
member.summary: Indicates the status of flash when the image was shot.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.FocalLength
member.summary: The actual focal length of the lens, in mm.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.FlashEnergy
member.summary: Amount of flash energy (BCPS).

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.SpatialFrequencyResponse
member.summary: SFR of the camera.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.Noise
member.summary: Noise measurement values.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.FocalPlaneXResolution
member.summary: Number of pixels per FocalPlaneResolutionUnit (37392) in ImageWidth direction for main image.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.FocalPlaneYResolution
member.summary: Number of pixels per FocalPlaneResolutionUnit (37392) in ImageLength direction for main image.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.FocalPlaneResolutionUnit
member.summary: Unit of measurement for FocalPlaneXResolution(37390) and FocalPlaneYResolution(37391).

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.ImageNumber
member.summary: Number assigned to an image, e.g., in a chained image burst.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.SecurityClassification
member.summary: Security classification assigned to the image.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.ImageHistory
member.summary: Record of what has been done to the image.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.SubjectLocation
member.summary: Indicates the location and area of the main subject in the overall scene.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.ExposureIndex
member.summary: Encodes the camera exposure index setting when image was captured.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.TIFFEPStandardID
member.summary: Contains four ASCII characters representing the TIFF/EP standard version of a TIFF/EP file, eg '1', '0', '0', '0'

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.SensingMethod
member.summary: Type of image sensor.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.XPTitle
member.summary: Title tag used by Windows, encoded in UCS2

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.XPComment
member.summary: Comment tag used by Windows, encoded in UCS2

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.XPAuthor
member.summary: Author tag used by Windows, encoded in UCS2

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.XPKeywords
member.summary: Keywords tag used by Windows, encoded in UCS2

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.XPSubject
member.summary: Subject tag used by Windows, encoded in UCS2

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.PrintImageMatching
member.summary: Print Image Matching, description needed.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.DNGVersion
member.summary: This tag encodes the DNG four-tier version number. For files compliant with version 1.1.0.0 of the DNG specification, this tag should contain the bytes: 1, 1, 0, 0.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.DNGBackwardVersion
member.summary: This tag specifies the oldest version of the Digital Negative specification for which a file is compatible. Readers shouldnot attempt to read a file if this tag specifies a version number that is higher than the version number of the specification the reader was based on. In addition to checking the version tags, readers should, for all tags, check the types, counts, and values, to verify it is able to correctly read the file.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.UniqueCameraModel
member.summary: Defines a unique, non-localized name for the camera model that created the image in the raw file. This name should include the manufacturer's name to avoid conflicts, and should not be localized, even if the camera name itself is localized for different markets (see LocalizedCameraModel). This string may be used by reader software to index into per-model preferences and replacement profiles.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.LocalizedCameraModel
member.summary: Similar to the UniqueCameraModel field, except the name can be localized for different markets to match the localization of the camera name.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.CFAPlaneColor
member.summary: Provides a mapping between the values in the CFAPattern tag and the plane numbers in LinearRaw space. This is a required tag for non-RGB CFA images.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.CFALayout
member.summary: Describes the spatial layout of the CFA.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.LinearizationTable
member.summary: Describes a lookup table that maps stored values into linear values. This tag is typically used to increase compression ratios by storing the raw data in a non-linear, more visually uniform space with fewer total encoding levels. If SamplesPerPixel is not equal to one, this single table applies to all the samples for each pixel.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.BlackLevelRepeatDim
member.summary: Specifies repeat pattern size for the BlackLevel tag.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.BlackLevel
member.summary: Specifies the zero light (a.k.a. thermal black or black current) encoding level, as a repeating pattern. The origin of this pattern is the top-left corner of the ActiveArea rectangle. The values are stored in row-column-sample scan order.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.BlackLevelDeltaH
member.summary: If the zero light encoding level is a function of the image column, BlackLevelDeltaH specifies the difference between the zero light encoding level for each column and the baseline zero light encoding level. If SamplesPerPixel is not equal to one, this single table applies to all the samples for each pixel.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.BlackLevelDeltaV
member.summary: If the zero light encoding level is a function of the image row, this tag specifies the difference between the zero light encoding level for each row and the baseline zero light encoding level. If SamplesPerPixel is not equal to one, this single table applies to all the samples for each pixel.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.WhiteLevel
member.summary: This tag specifies the fully saturated encoding level for the raw sample values. Saturation is caused either by the sensor itself becoming highly non-linear in response, or by the camera's analog to digital converter clipping.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.DefaultScale
member.summary: DefaultScale is required for cameras with non-square pixels. It specifies the default scale factors for each direction to convert the image to square pixels. Typically these factors are selected to approximately preserve total pixel count. For CFA images that use CFALayout equal to 2, 3, 4, or 5, such as the Fujifilm SuperCCD, these two values should usually differ by a factor of 2.0.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.DefaultCropOrigin
member.summary: Raw images often store extra pixels around the edges of the final image. These extra pixels help prevent interpolation artifacts near the edges of the final image. DefaultCropOrigin specifies the origin of the final image area, in raw image coordinates (i.e., before the DefaultScale has been applied), relative to the top-left corner of the ActiveArea rectangle.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.DefaultCropSize
member.summary: Raw images often store extra pixels around the edges of the final image. These extra pixels help prevent interpolation artifacts near the edges of the final image. DefaultCropSize specifies the size of the final image area, in raw image coordinates (i.e., before the DefaultScale has been applied).

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.ColorMatrix1
member.summary: ColorMatrix1 defines a transformation matrix that converts XYZ values to reference camera native color space values, under the first calibration illuminant. The matrix values are stored in row scan order. The ColorMatrix1 tag is required for all non-monochrome DNG files.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.ColorMatrix2
member.summary: ColorMatrix2 defines a transformation matrix that converts XYZ values to reference camera native color space values, under the second calibration illuminant. The matrix values are stored in row scan order.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.CameraCalibration1
member.summary: CameraCalibration1 defines a calibration matrix that transforms reference camera native space values to individual camera native space values under the first calibration illuminant. The matrix is stored in row scan order. This matrix is stored separately from the matrix specified by the ColorMatrix1 tag to allow raw converters to swap in replacement color matrices based on UniqueCameraModel tag, while still taking advantage of any per-individual camera calibration performed by the camera manufacturer.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.CameraCalibration2
member.summary: CameraCalibration2 defines a calibration matrix that transforms reference camera native space values to individual camera native space values under the second calibration illuminant. The matrix is stored in row scan order. This matrix is stored separately from the matrix specified by the ColorMatrix2 tag to allow raw converters to swap in replacement color matrices based on UniqueCameraModel tag, while still taking advantage of any per-individual camera calibration performed by the camera manufacturer.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.ReductionMatrix1
member.summary: ReductionMatrix1 defines a dimensionality reduction matrix for use as the first stage in converting color camera native space values to XYZ values, under the first calibration illuminant. This tag may only be used if ColorPlanes is greater than 3. The matrix is stored in row scan order.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.ReductionMatrix2
member.summary: ReductionMatrix2 defines a dimensionality reduction matrix for use as the first stage in converting color camera native space values to XYZ values, under the second calibration illuminant. This tag may only be used if ColorPlanes is greater than 3. The matrix is stored in row scan order.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.AnalogBalance
member.summary: Normally the stored raw values are not white balanced, since any digital white balancing will reduce the dynamic range of the final image if the user decides to later adjust the white balance; however, if camera hardware is capable of white balancing the color channels before the signal is digitized, it can improve the dynamic range of the final image. AnalogBalance defines the gain, either analog (recommended) or digital (not recommended) that has been applied the stored raw values.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.AsShotNeutral
member.summary: Specifies the selected white balance at time of capture, encoded as the coordinates of a perfectly neutral color in linear reference space values. The inclusion of this tag precludes the inclusion of the AsShotWhiteXY tag.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.AsShotWhiteXY
member.summary: Specifies the selected white balance at time of capture, encoded as x-y chromaticity coordinates. The inclusion of this tag precludes the inclusion of the AsShotNeutral tag.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.BaselineExposure
member.summary: Camera models vary in the trade-off they make between highlight headroom and shadow noise. Some leave a significant amount of highlight headroom during a normal exposure. This allows significant negative exposure compensation to be applied during raw conversion, but also means normal exposures will contain more shadow noise. Other models leave less headroom during normal exposures. This allows for less negative exposure compensation, but results in lower shadow noise for normal exposures. Because of these differences, a raw converter needs to vary the zero point of its exposure compensation control from model to model. BaselineExposure specifies by how much (in EV units) to move the zero point. Positive values result in brighter default results, while negative values result in darker default results.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.BaselineNoise
member.summary: Specifies the relative noise level of the camera model at a baseline ISO value of 100, compared to a reference camera model. Since noise levels tend to vary approximately with the square root of the ISO value, a raw converter can use this value, combined with the current ISO, to estimate the relative noise level of the current image.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.BaselineSharpness
member.summary: Specifies the relative amount of sharpening required for this camera model, compared to a reference camera model. Camera models vary in the strengths of their anti-aliasing filters. Cameras with weak or no filters require less sharpening than cameras with strong anti-aliasing filters.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.BayerGreenSplit
member.summary: Only applies to CFA images using a Bayer pattern filter array. This tag specifies, in arbitrary units, how closely the values of the green pixels in the blue/green rows track the values of the green pixels in the red/green rows. A value of zero means the two kinds of green pixels track closely, while a non-zero value means they sometimes diverge. The useful range for this tag is from 0 (no divergence) to about 5000 (quite large divergence).

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.LinearResponseLimit
member.summary: Some sensors have an unpredictable non-linearity in their response as they near the upper limit of their encoding range. This non-linearity results in color shifts in the highlight areas of the resulting image unless the raw converter compensates for this effect. LinearResponseLimit specifies the fraction of the encoding range above which the response may become significantly non-linear.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.CameraSerialNumber
member.summary: CameraSerialNumber contains the serial number of the camera or camera body that captured the image.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.LensInfo
member.summary: Contains information about the lens that captured the image. If the minimum f-stops are unknown, they should be encoded as 0/0.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.ChromaBlurRadius
member.summary: ChromaBlurRadius provides a hint to the DNG reader about how much chroma blur should be applied to the image. If this tag is omitted, the reader will use its default amount of chroma blurring. Normally this tag is only included for non-CFA images, since the amount of chroma blur required for mosaic images is highly dependent on the de-mosaic algorithm, in which case the DNG reader's default value is likely optimized for its particular de-mosaic algorithm.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.AntiAliasStrength
member.summary: Provides a hint to the DNG reader about how strong the camera's anti-alias filter is. A value of 0.0 means no anti-alias filter (i.e., the camera is prone to aliasing artifacts with some subjects), while a value of 1.0 means a strong anti-alias filter (i.e., the camera almost never has aliasing artifacts).

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.ShadowScale
member.summary: This tag is used by Adobe Camera Raw to control the sensitivity of its 'Shadows' slider.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.DNGPrivateData
member.summary: Provides a way for camera manufacturers to store private data in the DNG file for use by their own raw converters, and to have that data preserved by programs that edit DNG files.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.MakerNoteSafety
member.summary: MakerNoteSafety lets the DNG reader know whether the EXIF MakerNote tag is safe to preserve along with the rest of the EXIF data. File browsers and other image management software processing an image with a preserved MakerNote should be aware that any thumbnail image embedded in the MakerNote may be stale, and may not reflect the current state of the full size image.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.CalibrationIlluminant1
member.summary: The illuminant used for the first set of color calibration tags (ColorMatrix1, CameraCalibration1, ReductionMatrix1). The legal values for this tag are the same as the legal values for the LightSource EXIF tag.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.CalibrationIlluminant2
member.summary: The illuminant used for an optional second set of color calibration tags (ColorMatrix2, CameraCalibration2, ReductionMatrix2). The legal values for this tag are the same as the legal values for the CalibrationIlluminant1 tag; however, if both are included, neither is allowed to have a value of 0 (unknown).

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.BestQualityScale
member.summary: For some cameras, the best possible image quality is not achieved by preserving the total pixel count during conversion. For example, Fujifilm SuperCCD images have maximum detail when their total pixel count is doubled. This tag specifies the amount by which the values of the DefaultScale tag need to be multiplied to achieve the best quality image size.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.RawDataUniqueID
member.summary: This tag contains a 16-byte unique identifier for the raw image data in the DNG file. DNG readers can use this tag to recognize a particular raw image, even if the file's name or the metadata contained in the file has been changed. If a DNG writer creates such an identifier, it should do so using an algorithm that will ensure that it is very unlikely two different images will end up having the same identifier.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.OriginalRawFileName
member.summary: If the DNG file was converted from a non-DNG raw file, then this tag contains the file name of that original raw file.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.OriginalRawFileData
member.summary: If the DNG file was converted from a non-DNG raw file, then this tag contains the compressed contents of that original raw file. The contents of this tag always use the big-endian byte order. The tag contains a sequence of data blocks. Future versions of the DNG specification may define additional data blocks, so DNG readers should ignore extra bytes when parsing this tag. DNG readers should also detect the case where data blocks are missing from the end of the sequence, and should assume a default value for all the missing blocks. There are no padding or alignment bytes between data blocks.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.ActiveArea
member.summary: This rectangle defines the active (non-masked) pixels of the sensor. The order of the rectangle coordinates is: top, left, bottom, right.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.MaskedAreas
member.summary: This tag contains a list of non-overlapping rectangle coordinates of fully masked pixels, which can be optionally used by DNG readers to measure the black encoding level. The order of each rectangle's coordinates is: top, left, bottom, right. If the raw image data has already had its black encoding level subtracted, then this tag should not be used, since the masked pixels are no longer useful.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.AsShotICCProfile
member.summary: This tag contains an ICC profile that, in conjunction with the AsShotPreProfileMatrix tag, provides the camera manufacturer with a way to specify a default color rendering from camera color space coordinates (linear reference values) into the ICC profile connection space. The ICC profile connection space is an output referred colorimetric space, whereas the other color calibration tags in DNG specify a conversion into a scene referred colorimetric space. This means that the rendering in this profile should include any desired tone and gamut mapping needed to convert between scene referred values and output referred values.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.AsShotPreProfileMatrix
member.summary: This tag is used in conjunction with the AsShotICCProfile tag. It specifies a matrix that should be applied to the camera color space coordinates before processing the values through the ICC profile specified in the AsShotICCProfile tag. The matrix is stored in the row scan order. If ColorPlanes is greater than three, then this matrix can (but is not required to) reduce the dimensionality of the color data down to three components, in which case the AsShotICCProfile should have three rather than ColorPlanes input components.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.CurrentICCProfile
member.summary: This tag is used in conjunction with the CurrentPreProfileMatrix tag. The CurrentICCProfile and CurrentPreProfileMatrix tags have the same purpose and usage as the AsShotICCProfile and AsShotPreProfileMatrix tag pair, except they are for use by raw file editors rather than camera manufacturers.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.CurrentPreProfileMatrix
member.summary: This tag is used in conjunction with the CurrentICCProfile tag. The CurrentICCProfile and CurrentPreProfileMatrix tags have the same purpose and usage as the AsShotICCProfile and AsShotPreProfileMatrix tag pair, except they are for use by raw file editors rather than camera manufacturers.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.ColorimetricReference
member.summary: The DNG color model documents a transform between camera colors and CIE XYZ values. This tag describes the colorimetric reference for the CIE XYZ values. 0 = The XYZ values are scene-referred. 1 = The XYZ values are output-referred, using the ICC profile perceptual dynamic range. This tag allows output-referred data to be stored in DNG files and still processed correctly by DNG readers.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.CameraCalibrationSignature
member.summary: A UTF-8 encoded string associated with the CameraCalibration1 and CameraCalibration2 tags. The CameraCalibration1 and CameraCalibration2 tags should only be used in the DNG color transform if the string stored in the CameraCalibrationSignature tag exactly matches the string stored in the ProfileCalibrationSignature tag for the selected camera profile.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.ProfileCalibrationSignature
member.summary: A UTF-8 encoded string associated with the camera profile tags. The CameraCalibration1 and CameraCalibration2 tags should only be used in the DNG color transfer if the string stored in the CameraCalibrationSignature tag exactly matches the string stored in the ProfileCalibrationSignature tag for the selected camera profile.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.AsShotProfileName
member.summary: A UTF-8 encoded string containing the name of the "as shot" camera profile, if any.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.NoiseReductionApplied
member.summary: This tag indicates how much noise reduction has been applied to the raw data on a scale of 0.0 to 1.0. A 0.0 value indicates that no noise reduction has been applied. A 1.0 value indicates that the "ideal" amount of noise reduction has been applied, i.e. that the DNG reader should not apply additional noise reduction by default. A value of 0/0 indicates that this parameter is unknown.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.ProfileName
member.summary: A UTF-8 encoded string containing the name of the camera profile. This tag is optional if there is only a single camera profile stored in the file but is required for all camera profiles if there is more than one camera profile stored in the file.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.ProfileHueSatMapDims
member.summary: This tag specifies the number of input samples in each dimension of the hue/saturation/value mapping tables. The data for these tables are stored in ProfileHueSatMapData1 and ProfileHueSatMapData2 tags. The most common case has ValueDivisions equal to 1, so only hue and saturation are used as inputs to the mapping table.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.ProfileHueSatMapData1
member.summary: This tag contains the data for the first hue/saturation/value mapping table. Each entry of the table contains three 32-bit IEEE floating-point values. The first entry is hue shift in degrees; the second entry is saturation scale factor; and the third entry is a value scale factor. The table entries are stored in the tag in nested loop order, with the value divisions in the outer loop, the hue divisions in the middle loop, and the saturation divisions in the inner loop. All zero input saturation entries are required to have a value scale factor of 1.0.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.ProfileHueSatMapData2
member.summary: This tag contains the data for the second hue/saturation/value mapping table. Each entry of the table contains three 32-bit IEEE floating-point values. The first entry is hue shift in degrees; the second entry is a saturation scale factor; and the third entry is a value scale factor. The table entries are stored in the tag in nested loop order, with the value divisions in the outer loop, the hue divisions in the middle loop, and the saturation divisions in the inner loop. All zero input saturation entries are required to have a value scale factor of 1.0.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.ProfileToneCurve
member.summary: This tag contains a default tone curve that can be applied while processing the image as a starting point for user adjustments. The curve is specified as a list of 32-bit IEEE floating-point value pairs in linear gamma. Each sample has an input value in the range of 0.0 to 1.0, and an output value in the range of 0.0 to 1.0. The first sample is required to be (0.0, 0.0), and the last sample is required to be (1.0, 1.0). Interpolated the curve using a cubic spline.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.ProfileEmbedPolicy
member.summary: This tag contains information about the usage rules for the associated camera profile.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.ProfileCopyright
member.summary: A UTF-8 encoded string containing the copyright information for the camera profile. This string always should be preserved along with the other camera profile tags.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.ForwardMatrix1
member.summary: This tag defines a matrix that maps white balanced camera colors to XYZ D50 colors.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.ForwardMatrix2
member.summary: This tag defines a matrix that maps white balanced camera colors to XYZ D50 colors.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.PreviewApplicationName
member.summary: A UTF-8 encoded string containing the name of the application that created the preview stored in the IFD.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.PreviewApplicationVersion
member.summary: A UTF-8 encoded string containing the version number of the application that created the preview stored in the IFD.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.PreviewSettingsName
member.summary: A UTF-8 encoded string containing the name of the conversion settings (for example, snapshot name) used for the preview stored in the IFD.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.PreviewSettingsDigest
member.summary: A unique ID of the conversion settings (for example, MD5 digest) used to render the preview stored in the IFD.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.PreviewColorSpace
member.summary: This tag specifies the color space in which the rendered preview in this IFD is stored. The default value for this tag is sRGB for color previews and Gray Gamma 2.2 for monochrome previews.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.PreviewDateTime
member.summary: This tag is an ASCII string containing the name of the date/time at which the preview stored in the IFD was rendered. The date/time is encoded using ISO 8601 format.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.RawImageDigest
member.summary: This tag is an MD5 digest of the raw image data. All pixels in the image are processed in row-scan order. Each pixel is zero padded to 16 or 32 bits deep (16-bit for data less than or equal to 16 bits deep, 32-bit otherwise). The data for each pixel is processed in little-endian byte order.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.OriginalRawFileDigest
member.summary: This tag is an MD5 digest of the data stored in the OriginalRawFileData tag.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.SubTileBlockSize
member.summary: Normally, the pixels within a tile are stored in simple row-scan order. This tag specifies that the pixels within a tile should be grouped first into rectangular blocks of the specified size. These blocks are stored in row-scan order. Within each block, the pixels are stored in row-scan order. The use of a non-default value for this tag requires setting the DNGBackwardVersion tag to at least 1.2.0.0.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.RowInterleaveFactor
member.summary: This tag specifies that rows of the image are stored in interleaved order. The value of the tag specifies the number of interleaved fields. The use of a non-default value for this tag requires setting the DNGBackwardVersion tag to at least 1.2.0.0.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.ProfileLookTableDims
member.summary: This tag specifies the number of input samples in each dimension of a default "look" table. The data for this table is stored in the ProfileLookTableData tag.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.ProfileLookTableData
member.summary: This tag contains a default "look" table that can be applied while processing the image as a starting point for user adjustment. This table uses the same format as the tables stored in the ProfileHueSatMapData1 and ProfileHueSatMapData2 tags, and is applied in the same color space. However, it should be applied later in the processing pipe, after any exposure compensation and/or fill light stages, but before any tone curve stage. Each entry of the table contains three 32-bit IEEE floating-point values. The first entry is hue shift in degrees, the second entry is a saturation scale factor, and the third entry is a value scale factor. The table entries are stored in the tag in nested loop order, with the value divisions in the outer loop, the hue divisions in the middle loop, and the saturation divisions in the inner loop. All zero input saturation entries are required to have a value scale factor of 1.0.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.OpcodeList1
member.summary: Specifies the list of opcodes that should be applied to the raw image, as read directly from the file.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.OpcodeList2
member.summary: Specifies the list of opcodes that should be applied to the raw image, just after it has been mapped to linear reference values.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.OpcodeList3
member.summary: Specifies the list of opcodes that should be applied to the raw image, just after it has been demosaiced.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.NoiseProfile
member.summary: NoiseProfile describes the amount of noise in a raw image. Specifically, this tag models the amount of signal-dependent photon (shot) noise and signal-independent sensor readout noise, two common sources of noise in raw images. The model assumes that the noise is white and spatially independent, ignoring fixed pattern effects and other sources of noise (e.g., pixel response non-uniformity, spatially-dependent thermal effects, etc.).

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.TimeCodes
member.summary: The optional TimeCodes tag shall contain an ordered array of time codes. All time codes shall be 8 bytes long and in binary format. The tag may contain from 1 to 10 time codes. When the tag contains more than one time code, the first one shall be the default time code. This specification does not prescribe how to use multiple time codes. Each time code shall be as defined for the 8-byte time code structure in SMPTE 331M-2004, Section 8.3. See also SMPTE 12-1-2008 and SMPTE 309-1999.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.FrameRate
member.summary: The optional FrameRate tag shall specify the video frame rate in number of image frames per second, expressed as a signed rational number. The numerator shall be non-negative and the denominator shall be positive. This field value is identical to the sample rate field in SMPTE 377-1-2009.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.TStop
member.summary: The optional TStop tag shall specify the T-stop of the actual lens, expressed as an unsigned rational number. T-stop is also known as T-number or the photometric aperture of the lens. (F-number is the geometric aperture of the lens.) When the exact value is known, the T-stop shall be specified using a single number. Alternately, two numbers shall be used to indicate a T-stop range, in which case the first number shall be the minimum T-stop and the second number shall be the maximum T-stop.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.ReelName
member.summary: The optional ReelName tag shall specify a name for a sequence of images, where each image in the sequence has a unique image identifier (including but not limited to file name, frame number, date time, time code).

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.CameraLabel
member.summary: The optional CameraLabel tag shall specify a text label for how the camera is used or assigned in this clip. This tag is similar to CameraLabel in XMP.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.SensitivityType
member.summary: The SensitivityType tag indicates which one of the parameters of ISO12232 is the PhotographicSensitivity tag. Although it is an optional tag, it should be recorded when a PhotographicSensitivity tag is recorded. Value = 4, 5, 6, or 7 may be used in case that the values of plural parameters are the same.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.StandardOutputSensitivity
member.summary: This tag indicates the standard output sensitivity value of a camera or input device defined in ISO 12232. When recording this tag, the PhotographicSensitivity and SensitivityType tags shall also be recorded.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.RecommendedExposureIndex
member.summary: This tag indicates the recommended exposure index value of a camera or input device defined in ISO 12232. When recording this tag, the PhotographicSensitivity and SensitivityType tags shall also be recorded.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.ISOSpeed
member.summary: This tag indicates the ISO speed value of a camera or input device that is defined in ISO 12232. When recording this tag, the PhotographicSensitivity and SensitivityType tags shall also be recorded.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.ISOSpeedLatitudeyyy
member.summary: This tag indicates the ISO speed latitude yyy value of a camera or input device that is defined in ISO 12232. However, this tag shall not be recorded without ISOSpeed and ISOSpeedLatitudezzz.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.ISOSpeedLatitudezzz
member.summary: This tag indicates the ISO speed latitude zzz value of a camera or input device that is defined in ISO 12232. However, this tag shall not be recorded without ISOSpeed and ISOSpeedLatitudeyyy.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.ExifVersion
member.summary: The version of this standard supported. Nonexistence of this field is taken to mean nonconformance to the standard.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.DateTimeDigitized
member.summary: The date and time when the image was stored as digital data.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.ComponentsConfiguration
member.summary: Information specific to compressed data. The channels of each component are arranged in order from the 1st component to the 4th. For uncompressed data the data arrangement is given in the tag. However, since can only express the order of Y, Cb and Cr, this tag is provided for cases when compressed data uses components other than Y, Cb, and Cr and to enable support of other sequences.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.SubjectArea
member.summary: This tag indicates the location and area of the main subject in the overall scene.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.MakerNote
member.summary: A tag for manufacturers of Exif writers to record any desired information. The contents are up to the manufacturer.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.UserComment
member.summary: A tag for Exif users to write keywords or comments on the image besides those in , and without the character code limitations of the tag.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.SubSecTime
member.summary: A tag used to record fractions of seconds for the tag.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.SubSecTimeOriginal
member.summary: A tag used to record fractions of seconds for the tag.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.SubSecTimeDigitized
member.summary: A tag used to record fractions of seconds for the tag.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.FlashpixVersion
member.summary: The FlashPix format version supported by a FPXR file.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.ColorSpace
member.summary: The color space information tag is always recorded as the color space specifier. Normally sRGB is used to define the color space based on the PC monitor conditions and environment. If a color space other than sRGB is used, Uncalibrated is set. Image data recorded as Uncalibrated can be treated as sRGB when it is converted to FlashPix.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.PixelXDimension
member.summary: Information specific to compressed data. When a compressed file is recorded, the valid width of the meaningful image must be recorded in this tag, whether or not there is padding data or a restart marker. This tag should not exist in an uncompressed file.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.PixelYDimension
member.summary: Information specific to compressed data. When a compressed file is recorded, the valid height of the meaningful image must be recorded in this tag, whether or not there is padding data or a restart marker. This tag should not exist in an uncompressed file. Since data padding is unnecessary in the vertical direction, the number of lines recorded in this valid image height tag will in fact be the same as that recorded in the SOF.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.RelatedSoundFile
member.summary: This tag is used to record the name of an audio file related to the image data. The only relational information recorded here is the Exif audio file name and extension (an ASCII string consisting of 8 characters + '.' + 3 characters). The path is not recorded.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.InteroperabilityTag
member.summary: Interoperability IFD is composed of tags which stores the information to ensure the Interoperability and pointed by the following tag located in Exif IFD. The Interoperability structure of Interoperability IFD is the same as TIFF defined IFD structure but does not contain the image data characteristically compared with normal TIFF IFD.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.FileSource
member.summary: Indicates the image source. If a DSC recorded the image, this tag value of this tag always be set to 3, indicating that the image was recorded on a DSC.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.SceneType
member.summary: Indicates the type of scene. If a DSC recorded the image, this tag value must always be set to 1, indicating that the image was directly photographed.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.CustomRendered
member.summary: This tag indicates the use of special processing on image data, such as rendering geared to output. When special processing is performed, the reader is expected to disable or minimize any further processing.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.ExposureMode
member.summary: This tag indicates the exposure mode set when the image was shot. In auto-bracketing mode, the camera shoots a series of frames of the same scene at different exposure settings.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.WhiteBalance
member.summary: This tag indicates the white balance mode set when the image was shot.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.DigitalZoomRatio
member.summary: This tag indicates the digital zoom ratio when the image was shot. If the numerator of the recorded value is 0, this indicates that digital zoom was not used.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.FocalLengthIn35mmFilm
member.summary: This tag indicates the equivalent focal length assuming a 35mm film camera, in mm. A value of 0 means the focal length is unknown. Note that this tag differs from the tag.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.SceneCaptureType
member.summary: This tag indicates the type of scene that was shot. It can also be used to record the mode in which the image was shot. Note that this differs from the tag.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.GainControl
member.summary: This tag indicates the degree of overall image gain adjustment.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.Contrast
member.summary: This tag indicates the direction of contrast processing applied by the camera when the image was shot.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.Saturation
member.summary: This tag indicates the direction of saturation processing applied by the camera when the image was shot.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.Sharpness
member.summary: This tag indicates the direction of sharpness processing applied by the camera when the image was shot.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.DeviceSettingDescription
member.summary: This tag indicates information on the picture-taking conditions of a particular camera model. The tag is used only to indicate the picture-taking conditions in the reader.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.SubjectDistanceRange
member.summary: This tag indicates the distance to the subject.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.ImageUniqueID
member.summary: This tag indicates an identifier assigned uniquely to each image. It is recorded as an ASCII string equivalent to hexadecimal notation and 128-bit fixed length.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.CameraOwnerName
member.summary: This tag records the owner of a camera used in photography as an ASCII string.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.BodySerialNumber
member.summary: This tag records the serial number of the body of the camera that was used in photography as an ASCII string.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.LensSpecification
member.summary: This tag notes minimum focal length, maximum focal length, minimum F number in the minimum focal length, and minimum F number in the maximum focal length, which are specification information for the lens that was used in photography. When the minimum F number is unknown, the notation is 0/0

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.LensMake
member.summary: This tag records the lens manufactor as an ASCII string.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.LensModel
member.summary: This tag records the lens's model name and model number as an ASCII string.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.LensSerialNumber
member.summary: This tag records the serial number of the interchangeable lens that was used in photography as an ASCII string.
