member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.InteroperabilityIndex
member.summary: Indicates the identification of the Interoperability rule. Use "R98" for stating ExifR98 Rules. Four bytes used including the termination code (NULL). see the separate volume of Recommended Exif Interoperability Rules (ExifR98) for other tags used for ExifR98.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.InteroperabilityVersion
member.summary: Interoperability version

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.RelatedImageFileFormat
member.summary: File format of image file

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.RelatedImageWidth
member.summary: Image width

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.RelatedImageLength
member.summary: Image height

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.GPSVersionID
member.summary: Indicates the version of GPSInfoIFD. The version is given as 2.0.0.0. This tag is mandatory when GPSInfo tag is present. (Note: The tag is given in bytes, unlike the tag. When the version is 2.0.0.0, the tag value is 02000000.H).

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.GPSLatitudeRef
member.summary: Indicates whether the latitude is north or south latitude. The ASCII value 'N' indicates north latitude, and 'S' is south latitude.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.GPSLatitude
member.summary: Indicates the latitude. The latitude is expressed as three RATIONAL values giving the degrees, minutes, and seconds, respectively. When degrees, minutes and seconds are expressed, the format is dd/1,mm/1,ss/1. When degrees and minutes are used and, for example, fractions of minutes are given up to two decimal places, the format is dd/1,mmmm/100,0/1.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.GPSLongitudeRef
member.summary: Indicates whether the longitude is east or west longitude. ASCII 'E' indicates east longitude, and 'W' is west longitude.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.GPSLongitude
member.summary: Indicates the longitude. The longitude is expressed as three RATIONAL values giving the degrees, minutes, and seconds, respectively. When degrees, minutes and seconds are expressed, the format is ddd/1,mm/1,ss/1. When degrees and minutes are used and, for example, fractions of minutes are given up to two decimal places, the format is ddd/1,mmmm/100,0/1.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.GPSAltitudeRef
member.summary: Indicates the altitude used as the reference altitude. If the reference is sea level and the altitude is above sea level, 0 is given. If the altitude is below sea level, a value of 1 is given and the altitude is indicated as an absolute value in the GSPAltitude tag. The reference unit is meters. Note that this tag is BYTE type, unlike other reference tags.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.GPSAltitude
member.summary: Indicates the altitude based on the reference in GPSAltitudeRef. Altitude is expressed as one RATIONAL value. The reference unit is meters.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.GPSTimeStamp
member.summary: Indicates the time as UTC (Coordinated Universal Time). TimeStamp is expressed as three RATIONAL values giving the hour, minute, and second (atomic clock).

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.GPSSatellites
member.summary: Indicates the GPS satellites used for measurements. This tag can be used to describe the number of satellites, their ID number, angle of elevation, azimuth, SNR and other information in ASCII notation. The format is not specified. If the GPS receiver is incapable of taking measurements, value of the tag is set to NULL.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.GPSStatus
member.summary: Indicates the status of the GPS receiver when the image is recorded. "A" means measurement is in progress, and "V" means the measurement is Interoperability.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.GPSMeasureMode
member.summary: Indicates the GPS measurement mode. "2" means two-dimensional measurement and "3" means three-dimensional measurement is in progress.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.GPSDOP
member.summary: Indicates the GPS DOP (data degree of precision). An HDOP value is written during two-dimensional measurement, and PDOP during three-dimensional measurement.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.GPSSpeedRef
member.summary: Indicates the unit used to express the GPS receiver speed of movement. "K" "M" and "N" represents kilometers per hour, miles per hour, and knots.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.GPSSpeed
member.summary: Indicates the speed of GPS receiver movement.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.GPSTrackRef
member.summary: Indicates the reference for giving the direction of GPS receiver movement. "T" denotes true direction and "M" is magnetic direction.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.GPSTrack
member.summary: Indicates the direction of GPS receiver movement. The range of values is from 0.00 to 359.99.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.GPSImgDirectionRef
member.summary: Indicates the reference for giving the direction of the image when it is captured. "T" denotes true direction and "M" is magnetic direction.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.GPSImgDirection
member.summary: Indicates the direction of the image when it was captured. The range of values is from 0.00 to 359.99.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.GPSMapDatum
member.summary: Indicates the geodetic survey data used by the GPS receiver. If the survey data is restricted to Japan, the value of this tag is "TOKYO" or "WGS-84".

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.GPSDestLatitudeRef
member.summary: Indicates whether the latitude of the destination point is north or south latitude. The ASCII value "N" indicates north latitude, and "S" is south latitude.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.GPSDestLatitude
member.summary: Indicates the latitude of the destination point. The latitude is expressed as three RATIONAL values giving the degrees, minutes, and seconds, respectively. If latitude is expressed as degrees, minutes and seconds, a typical format would be dd/1,mm/1,ss/1. When degrees and minutes are used and, for example, fractions of minutes are given up to two decimal places, the format would be dd/1,mmmm/100,0/1.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.GPSDestLongitudeRef
member.summary: Indicates whether the longitude of the destination point is east or west longitude. ASCII "E" indicates east longitude, and "W" is west longitude.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.GPSDestLongitude
member.summary: Indicates the longitude of the destination point. The longitude is expressed as three RATIONAL values giving the degrees, minutes, and seconds, respectively. If longitude is expressed as degrees, minutes and seconds, a typical format would be ddd/1,mm/1,ss/1. When degrees and minutes are used and, for example, fractions of minutes are given up to two decimal places, the format would be ddd/1,mmmm/100,0/1.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.GPSDestBearingRef
member.summary: Indicates the reference used for giving the bearing to the destination point. "T" denotes true direction and "M" is magnetic direction.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.GPSDestBearing
member.summary: Indicates the bearing to the destination point. The range of values is from 0.00 to 359.99.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.GPSDestDistanceRef
member.summary: Indicates the unit used to express the distance to the destination point. "K", "M" and "N" represent kilometers, miles and knots.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.GPSDestDistance
member.summary: Indicates the distance to the destination point.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.GPSProcessingMethod
member.summary: A character string recording the name of the method used for location finding. The first byte indicates the character code used, and this is followed by the name of the method.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.GPSAreaInformation
member.summary: A character string recording the name of the GPS area. The first byte indicates the character code used, and this is followed by the name of the GPS area.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.GPSDateStamp
member.summary: A character string recording date and time information relative to UTC (Coordinated Universal Time). The format is "YYYY:MM:DD.".

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ExifTag.GPSDifferential
member.summary: Indicates whether differential correction is applied to the GPS receiver.

member.name: T:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.IptcTag
member.summary: Defines tags for IPTC (International Press Telecommunications Council) Information Interchange Model (IIM) 4.1 specification.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.IptcTag.Unknown
member.summary: Unknown tag.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.IptcTag.RecordVersion
member.summary: A binary number identifying the version of the Information Interchange Model, Part II, utilised by the provider. Version numbers are assigned by IPTC and NAA organizations.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.IptcTag.ObjectType
member.summary: The Object Type is used to distinguish between different types of objects within the IIM. The first part is a number representing a language independent international reference to an Object Type followed by a colon separator. The second part, if used, is a text representation of the Object Type Number consisting of graphic characters plus spaces either in English or in the language of the service as indicated in tag LanguageIdentifier

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.IptcTag.ObjectAttribute
member.summary: The Object Attribute defines the nature of the object independent of the Subject. The first part is a number representing a language independent international reference to an Object Attribute followed by a colon separator. The second part, if used, is a text representation of the Object Attribute Number consisting of graphic characters plus spaces either in English, or in the language of the service as indicated in tag LanguageIdentifier

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.IptcTag.ObjectName
member.summary: Used as a shorthand reference for the object. Changes to exist-ing data, such as updated stories or new crops on photos, should be identified in tag .

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.IptcTag.EditStatus
member.summary: Status of the object data, according to the practice of the provider.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.IptcTag.EditorialUpdate
member.summary: Indicates the type of update that this object provides to a previous object. The link to the previous object is made using the tags ARMIdentifier and ARMVersion, according to the practices of the provider.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.IptcTag.Urgency
member.summary: Specifies the editorial urgency of content and not necessarily the envelope handling priority (see tag EnvelopePriority). The "1" is most urgent, "5" normal and "8" denotes the least-urgent copy.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.IptcTag.Subject
member.summary: The Subject Reference is a structured definition of the subject matter.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.IptcTag.Category
member.summary: Identifies the subject of the object data in the opinion of the provider. A list of categories will be maintained by a regional registry, where available, otherwise by the provider.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.IptcTag.SuppCategory
member.summary: Supplemental categories further refine the subject of an object data. A supplemental category may include any of the recognised categories as used in tag . Otherwise, selection of supplemental categories are left to the provider.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.IptcTag.FixtureId
member.summary: Identifies object data that recurs often and predictably. Enables users to immediately find or recall such an object.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.IptcTag.Keywords
member.summary: Used to indicate specific information retrieval words. It is expected that a provider of various types of data that are related in subject matter uses the same keyword, enabling the receiving system or subsystems to search across all types of data for related material.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.IptcTag.LocationCode
member.summary: Indicates the code of a country/geographical location referenced by the content of the object. Where ISO has established an appropriate country code under ISO 3166, that code will be used. When ISO 3166 does not adequately provide for identification of a location or a country, e.g. ships at sea, space, IPTC will assign an appropriate three-character code under the provisions of ISO 3166 to avoid conflicts.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.IptcTag.LocationName
member.summary: Provides a full, publishable name of a country/geographical location referenced by the content of the object, according to guidelines of the provider.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.IptcTag.ReleaseDate
member.summary: Designates in the form CCYYMMDD the earliest date the provider intends the object to be used. Follows ISO 8601 standard.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.IptcTag.ReleaseTime
member.summary: Designates in the form HHMMSS:HHMM the earliest time the provider intends the object to be used. Follows ISO 8601 standard.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.IptcTag.ExpirationDate
member.summary: Designates in the form CCYYMMDD the latest date the provider or owner intends the object data to be used. Follows ISO 8601 standard.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.IptcTag.ExpirationTime
member.summary: Designates in the form HHMMSS:HHMM the latest time the provider or owner intends the object data to be used. Follows ISO 8601 standard.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.IptcTag.SpecialInstructions
member.summary: Other editorial instructions concerning the use of the object data, such as embargoes and warnings.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.IptcTag.ActionAdvised
member.summary: Indicates the type of action that this object provides to a previous object. The link to the previous object is made using tags ARMIdentifier and ARMVersion, according to the practices of the provider.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.IptcTag.ReferenceService
member.summary: Identifies the Service Identifier of a prior envelope to which the current object refers.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.IptcTag.ReferenceDate
member.summary: Identifies the date of a prior envelope to which the current object refers.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.IptcTag.ReferenceNumber
member.summary: Identifies the Envelope Number of a prior envelope to which the current object refers.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.IptcTag.DateCreated
member.summary: Represented in the form CCYYMMDD to designate the date the intellectual content of the object data was created rather than the date of the creation of the physical representation. Follows ISO 8601 standard.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.IptcTag.TimeCreated
member.summary: Represented in the form HHMMSS:HHMM to designate the time the intellectual content of the object data current source material was created rather than the creation of the physical representation. Follows ISO 8601 standard.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.IptcTag.DigitizationDate
member.summary: Represented in the form CCYYMMDD to designate the date the digital representation of the object data was created. Follows ISO 8601 standard.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.IptcTag.DigitizationTime
member.summary: Represented in the form HHMMSS:HHMM to designate the time the digital representation of the object data was created. Follows ISO 8601 standard.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.IptcTag.Program
member.summary: Identifies the type of program used to originate the object data.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.IptcTag.ProgramVersion
member.summary: Used to identify the version of the program mentioned in tag .

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.IptcTag.ObjectCycle
member.summary: Used to identify the editorial cycle of object data.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.IptcTag.Byline
member.summary: Contains name of the creator of the object data, e.g. writer, photographer or graphic artist.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.IptcTag.BylineTitle
member.summary: A by-line title is the title of the creator or creators of an object data. Where used, a by-line title should follow the by-line it modifies.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.IptcTag.City
member.summary: Identifies city of object data origin according to guidelines established by the provider.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.IptcTag.SubLocation
member.summary: Identifies the location within a city from which the object data originates, according to guidelines established by the provider.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.IptcTag.ProvinceState
member.summary: Identifies Province/State of origin according to guidelines established by the provider.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.IptcTag.CountryCode
member.summary: Indicates the code of the country/primary location where the intellectual property of the object data was created, e.g. a photo was taken, an event occurred. Where ISO has established an appropriate country code under ISO 3166, that code will be used. When ISO 3166 does not adequately provide for identification of a location or a new country, e.g. ships at sea, space, IPTC will assign an appropriate three-character code under the provisions of ISO 3166 to avoid conflicts.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.IptcTag.CountryName
member.summary: Provides full, publishable, name of the country/primary location where the intellectual property of the object data was created, according to guidelines of the provider.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.IptcTag.TransmissionReference
member.summary: A code representing the location of original transmission according to practices of the provider.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.IptcTag.Headline
member.summary: A publishable entry providing a synopsis of the contents of the object data.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.IptcTag.Credit
member.summary: Identifies the provider of the object data, not necessarily the owner/creator.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.IptcTag.Source
member.summary: Identifies the original owner of the intellectual content of the object data. This could be an agency, a member of an agency or an individual.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.IptcTag.Copyright
member.summary: Contains any necessary copyright notice.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.IptcTag.Contact
member.summary: Identifies the person or organisation which can provide further background information on the object data.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.IptcTag.Caption
member.summary: A textual description of the object data.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.IptcTag.Writer
member.summary: Identification of the name of the person involved in the writing, editing or correcting the object data or caption/abstract.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.IptcTag.RasterizedCaption
member.summary: Contains the rasterized object data description and is used where characters that have not been coded are required for the caption.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.IptcTag.ImageType
member.summary: Indicates the color components of an image.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.IptcTag.ImageOrientation
member.summary: Indicates the layout of an image.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.IptcTag.Language
member.summary: Describes the major national language of the object, according to the 2-letter codes of ISO 639:1988. Does not define or imply any coded character set, but is used for internal routing, e.g. to various editorial desks.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.IptcTag.AudioType
member.summary: Indicates the type of an audio content.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.IptcTag.AudioRate
member.summary: Indicates the sampling rate in Hertz of an audio content.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.IptcTag.AudioResolution
member.summary: Indicates the sampling resolution of an audio content.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.IptcTag.AudioDuration
member.summary: Indicates the duration of an audio content.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.IptcTag.AudioOutcue
member.summary: Identifies the content of the end of an audio object data, according to guidelines established by the provider.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.IptcTag.PreviewFormat
member.summary: A binary number representing the file format of the object data preview. The file format must be registered with IPTC or NAA organizations with a unique number assigned to it.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.IptcTag.PreviewVersion
member.summary: A binary number representing the particular version of the object data preview file format specified in tag .

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.IptcTag.Preview
member.summary: Binary image preview data.

member.name: T:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ResizeMode
member.summary: Defines the resize modes which are used to determine the resulting width and height of an image and resolve aspect ratio differences between the requested dimensions and the original image's dimensions.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ResizeMode.Max
member.summary: Width and height are considered maximum values. Either the resulting width or height may be smaller than the given ones to maintain the aspect ratio. The resize will not occur if the image is already smaller than the given size.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ResizeMode.MaxFit
member.summary: Same as but the resize will occur even if the image is already smaller than the given size.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ResizeMode.Min
member.summary: Width and height are considered minimum values. Either the resulting width or height may be larger than the given ones to maintain the aspect ratio. The resize will not occur if the image is already larger than the given size.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ResizeMode.MinFit
member.summary: Same as but the resize will occur even if the image is already larger than the given size.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ResizeMode.Stretch
member.summary: Width and height are considered exact values. The image is stretched if there is an aspect ratio difference.

member.name: F:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ResizeMode.Percentage
member.summary: Width and height are treated as percentages. If either width or height is specified, width and height are both scaled by the same percentage, maintaining the aspect ratio. If both width and height are specified, width and height are individually scaled by the respective percentage, ignoring the aspect ratio.

member.name: M:GleamTech.ImageUltimate.ImageTaskBase`1.Thumbnail(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Smartly generates a thumbnail from the current image. This method is optimized for thumbnails so you should prefer it over , or methods. This command should be the first one in the chain. Most image formats (Jpg, Tiff, Psd and Camera Raw files) can have EXIF thumbnails so this method will first try to read that image from EXIF metadata, remove black stripes above and below it and resize it down further if needed. This will ensure very fast performance when your whole purpose is generating thumbnails. Only if there is no thumbnail in metadata or the thumbnail is smaller than the requested size, the thumbnail will be created by resizing the original image as usual. EXIF thumbnails are typically in size 160x120.
member.remarks: All modern cameras write EXIF metadata when capturing an image most cameras save a thumbnail to the EXIF block. When a camera creates an EXIF thumbnail it fixes its size to the default industry size 160x120 pixels independently of an original image dimensions. Thus, it is possible that proportions of an original image and its thumbnail will be different for some camera types. If so the thumbnail will have black stripes above and below it, fortunately this method automatically removes those black stripes for offering you the best thumbnail out of the box. Besides digital photos, also software like Photoshop can store EXIF thumbnails when saving some formats (eg. Psd, Jpg, Tiff). For example, instead of merging layers of a Psd file by using the already available preview thumbnail in the file this method will run very quickly.
member.param: The desired width of the resulting image. If value is 0, width will be automatically calculated to preserve aspect ratio. Otherwise width will be considered maximum value so the resulting width may be smaller than the given one to maintain the aspect ratio.

The desired height of the resulting image. If value is 0, height will be automatically calculated to preserve aspect ratio. Otherwise height will be considered maximum value so the resulting height may be smaller than the given one to maintain the aspect ratio.
member.returns: The same instance of this class.

member.summary: Resizes the current image to the given dimensions in content-aware manner (seam carving). The command is added to the chain and not executed until the actual processing is done.
member.param: The desired width of the resulting image. If value is 0, width will be automatically calculated to preserve aspect ratio. Value will be treated as percentage when is used.
The desired height of the resulting image. If value is 0, height will be automatically calculated to preserve aspect ratio. Value will be treated as percentage when is used.
The resize mode which is used to determine the resulting width and height and resolve aspect ratio differences.
member.returns: The same instance of this class.
